# Introduction

---
## Motivation: Doing the Work

Continuous Integration (CI) & Continuous Deployment (CD) automate the iffy stuff

--

During R package development, you most likely will have to things repeatedly:

--

- Run checks (`R CMD check`) to see if your package can be built

--

- Update documentation via `{roxygen2}`

--

- Deploy a documentation site (e.g. `{pkgdown}`)

--

- Run tests .font60[(because you *have* tests)]

--

- Check test coverage via e.g. [codecov.io](https://codecov.io/)

---
class: middle
## Motivation: Automation

Modern tools like `{devtools}`, `{pkgdown}`, `{testthat}`, `{covr}` already make the individual steps quite easy.  

--
...But you still have to push the button manually.  
Repeatedly.  

--

Repeated tasks are chores, and chores make us sad ðŸ¥º

--

$\rightarrow$ Cintinuous {Integration,Deployment} to the rescue ðŸš€
